glsa.title: BIND: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in BIND might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: BIND (Berkeley Internet Name Domain) is a Name Server.

description.p: A defect in BINDâ€™s handling of responses containing a DNAME answer can cause a resolver to exit after encountering an assertion failure in db.c or resolver.c.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted DNS request to the BIND resolver possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All BIND users should upgrade to the latest version:
